title: Why can I not see the ozone layer? - Quora

response.answer_text: The ozone which is present in a thin, diffuse, layer in the lower stratosphere, CAN be seen—-not (consciously) by your eyes, but by your skin—-not by is presence, which is protective, but by its absence. Without the protection of the zone layer, exposed skin would quickly start suffering damage which would soon be felt. Over time, the growth of cataracts in your eyes would make you blind, a process which actually occurred to sheep in Patagonia, when the “hole” was at its peak in the late eighties. So don’t assume, as many seem to do, that only things that can be seen with our eyes actually matter in our lives. Other senses also matter, including those beyond the traditional “5”.
Hmmmmm, same reason you can’t see the air around you, it’s not only gas but a few kilometres above your head.
